1.text: And Job addeth to lift up his simile, and saith:—

2.text: God liveth! He turned aside my judgment, And the Mighty—He made my soul bitter.

3.text: For all the while my breath is in me, And the spirit of God in my nostrils.

4.text: My lips do not speak perverseness, And my tongue doth not utter deceit.

5.text: Pollution to me—if I justify you, Till I expire I turn not aside mine integrity from me.

6.text: On my righteousness I have laid hold, And I do not let it go, My heart doth not reproach me while I live.

7.text: As the wicked is my enemy, And my withstander as the perverse.

8.text: For what is the hope of the profane, When He doth cut off? When God doth cast off his soul?

9.text: His cry doth God hear, When distress cometh on him?

10.text: On the Mighty doth he delight himself? Call God at all times?

11.text: I shew you by the hand of God, That which is with the Mighty I hide not.

12.text: Lo, ye—all of you—have seen, And why is this—ye are altogether vain?

13.text: This is the portion of wicked man with God, And the inheritance of terrible ones From the Mighty they receive.

14.text: If his sons multiply—for them is a sword. And his offspring are not satisfied with bread.

15.text: His remnant in death are buried, And his widows do not weep.

16.text: If he heap up as dust silver, And as clay prepare clothing,

17.text: He prepareth—and the righteous putteth it on, And the silver the innocent doth apportion.

18.text: He hath built as a moth his house, And as a booth a watchman hath made.

19.text: Rich he lieth down, and he is not gathered, His eyes he hath opened, and he is not.

20.text: Overtake him as waters do terrors, By night stolen him away hath a whirlwind.

21.text: Take him up doth an east wind, and he goeth, And it frighteneth him from his place,

22.text: And it casteth at him, and doth not spare, From its hand he diligently fleeth.

23.text: It clappeth at him its hands, And it hisseth at him from his place.
